title: NIA charge sheet five Maoist operatives for involvement in Army man’s murder
content: Motiram Achala, an Indian Army soldier, was shot by CPI (Maoist) cadres at a village fair in Useli while he was visiting his family in February 2023

title: Drones critical to modern warfare, need to be part of policy: Rajnath Singh
content: Countries that invested in drone technology have gained a significant edge in this field, while many others have been left behind. From my six to six-and-a-half years of experience (as Defence Minister), says Rajnath Singh

title: Telangana Cabinet clears Kodandaram, Azharuddin for MLC posts under Governor’s Quota
content: The Cabinet that met in the Assembly decided to send the two names to the Governor for clearance after the Supreme Court stayed the earlier nominations

title: Islamic groups opposed to inviting Javed Akhtar force Bengal’s Urdu Academy to call off literary event
content: Akhtar, one of the best-known living Urdu poets in the country, takes pride in being an atheist, which these groups oppose, sources said

title: Tamil Nadu government shortlists two sites for Rameswaram airport
content: TIDCO recently identified five potential sites, and now the State government has narrowed it down to two: one near Uchipulli and another near Keelakarai, sources said

title: PM Modi lands in China after seven years; all eyes on his talks with President Xi on August 31
content: PM Modi is also expected to hold bilateral talks Russian President Vladimir Putin and a number of other leaders on the margins of the summit

title: Idol of Ganesh modelled on Telangana CM removed after objections in Hyderabad
content: The idol had been installed by Fisheries Federation Chairman Mettu Sai Kumar but was reportedly removed after he received calls objecting to the depiction

title: Union Minister Pemmasani stresses coordination for Railway and housing projects in A.P.’s Guntur
content: Pemmasani Sekhar noted that tenders for several railway bridges have been completed and foundation would be laid soon for it

title: Global traders see hope as Donald Trump’s tariffs head to U.S. Supreme Court; GTRI urges India to act
content: The Supreme Court outcome could determine whether Mr. Trump’s tariff regime survives or collapses, reshaping global trade flows in the process.

title: Watch: How Kerala became India’s first fully digitally literate State
content: On August 21, the State announced the successful completion of the first phase of the Digi Keralam project, which worked at the local level to teach digital skills and bridge the digital divide

title: Crime Branch to probe Keezhara blast; case registered against accused in 2016 Podikund blast case
content: Police have registered a case under the Explosive Substances Act against Anoop Malik who had taken the house for rent

title: TTD explores solutions for solid waste management
content: The EO stressed the need to explore systems that minimize dependence on large-scale waste segregation, thereby making management both cost-effective and practical for a pilgrim town that sees lakhs of devotees each month

title: Why is India’s trade deficit with China a concern? What is the risk of increasing dependence? | Explained
content: India has time and again flagged its concern over the ballooning trade deficit and the non-trade barriers faced by Indian goods in the Chinese market

title: ED alerts Interpol member countries on unique money laundering modus operandi; gets Purple Notice published
content: The publishing of the Purple Notice, on August 21, was an attempt at generating awareness and sensitising its global counterparts to the new emerging money laundering trends, says the probe agency

title: Flood in Godavari rising, many habitations cut-off from mainstream
content: At Bhadrachalam water level was recorded at 47.30 feet, officials discharge 11.11 lakh cusecs to the downstream, and inflows from Peruru and Dummugudem were rising, says Irrigation officials

title: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman calls for smooth functioning of NDA in T.N.
content: “Let us not worry about small rifts. There are mature leaders in the alliance. Let us have the conviction and discipline to bring about a regime change, which is what Tamil Nadu wants,” Ms. Sitharaman says

title: PM Modi’s gifts to Prime Minister of Japan and his wife
content: After wrapping up a two-day visit to Japan, the Prime Minister left for China to attend the SCO summit.

title: If I wasn’t a Dalit: Tamil Nadu professor fights legal battle to get his university job and dignity back
content: Since being removed from his assistant professor position at Manonmaniam Sundaranar University a year ago, P. Senrayaperumal has gone back to performing folk art to make ends meet

title: Traveller nabbed with live ammunition in Hyderabad turns out to be Ajnala firing case accused
content: Sukhdeep Singh, who was detained at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport after live ammunition was recovered from his baggage, has been identified as an accused in the Ajnala firing case of 2023

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy recalls Maganti Gopinath’s contributions as Assembly passes condolence motion; adjourns session
content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy, who moved the motion on the first day of the sixth session, recalled Maganti Gopinath’s political journey, describing his death as an irreparable loss to his family and constituency

title: 71st Nehru Trophy Boat Race gets underway in Alappuzha
content: As many as 75 boats, including 21 chundan vallams (snakeboats), are taking part in the annual regatta on Punnamada Lake

title: Congress leaders not apologising for 'abuses' against PM Modi, instead politicising issue: Himanta Biswa Sharma
content: "Far from apologising, the Congress is trying to give a political colour by alleging that a BJP worker from Madhya Pradesh was arrested in this connection," Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: PM Modi concludes Japan visit, heads to China for SCO summit
content: During his visit, India and Japan firmed up 13 key agreements and declarations and announced the launch of several key initiatives

title: PM Modi visits semiconductor facility in Japan's Sendai
content: TEL Miyagi, a leading Japanese company in the semiconductor sector, has plans for collaborations with India.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw inaugurates Optiemus' tempered glass factory entailing ₹870 crore investment
content: Optiemus Infracom has invested ₹70 crore in the first phase of the factory with installed capacity of 25 million units per annum, generating direct employment for over 600 people

title: India can’t afford to rely on foreign supplies in defence sector, says Rajnath Singh
content: The Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the air defence shield will comprise both defensive and offensive elements to deal with any enemy threats

title: Ghose Commission’s debate in Assembly: KCR, Harish Rao move Telangana High Court to restrain government from taking coercive action against them
content: Chandrasekhara Rao and Harish Rao filed separate interim applications in their respective writ petitions (no. 24837 and no. 24835) filed recently seeking to quash the Commission’s report that indicted them over alleged irregularities in execution of Kaleshwaram project

title: RCB announces ₹25 lakh financial aid to families of stampede victims
content: On August 29, 2025, RCB broke a three-month long silence with a condolence post. “The Silence wasn’t Absence. It was Grief,” the statement read.

title: Congress councillor, accused of ‘funding conversions’, surrenders at Indore Court after two months
content: The Congress Councillor had been booked for criminal conspiracy and provisions of the Madhya Pradesh Freedom of Religion Act, 2021, and a search was launched against him

title: Ten detained after clash between two groups at Siddapura in Bengaluru
content: According to police, the trouble began on August 27 when a minor boy riding a two-wheeler hit a woman at Kaveramma Layout

title: Delhi Zoo shut for visitors after painted storks test positive for bird flu
content: Samples from the two dead birds were sent to the National Institute for High Security Animal Diseases (NIHSAD) in Bhopal on August 27. They tested positive for H5N1 on August 28, they said

title: Cyberabad Traffic Police withdraw diversion check posts on NH-44 after road repair
content: Diversion check posts were earlier set up at ORR Exit-6 and pillar number 57, Medchal, after torrential rains left parts of the Highway between Kamareddy, Dichpally and Armoor severely damaged

title: 'Less than 50 weapons': IAF on Op Sindoor; reveals why Pak asked for ceasefire
content: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari recounted Operation Sindoor, revealing that fewer than 50 weapons strikes by the IAF on Pakistani military targets compelled Islamabad to request a ceasefire by May 10. These precision strikes, some hitting targets untouched even in the 1971 war, demonstrated India's air dominance and strategic planning, effectively conveying a strong message while minimizing collateral damage.

title: 'Trump is dead': Trolls trend amid US prez health concerns; link to Vance's remark
content: Social media buzzed with rumors of US President Donald Trump's death after a 72-hour absence from public view, fueled by health concerns and trending hashtags. Despite the White House attributing his symptoms to chronic venous insufficiency and minor soft tissue irritation, speculation persisted. Vice-President JD Vance's comments about being ready for the Oval Office further ignited the rumors.

title: PM Modi in China: Meet with Xi, Putin lined up amid Trump tariff strain - list of SCO attendees
content: Tianjin is preparing to host the SCO Summit, with President Xi Jinping welcoming leaders including PM Modi and President Putin. Against a backdrop of global tensions heightened by US tariffs, the summit aims to project China as a stabilizing force and foster unity among the Global South. Discussions will likely encompass counterterrorism, trade, and a multipolar world order.

title: 'Good to see such fear': RJD MP claims RSS 'sleeper cell' abused PM
content: RJD MP Sudhakar Singh alleged that BJP and RSS "sleeper cells" orchestrated the abuse directed at PM Modi during a Bihar opposition rally, echoing Congress's claim of planted "BJP agents." This follows a viral video showing unidentified men hurling abuses at PM Modi and his mother during Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar Yatra.

title: Tighter US visa norms: Students rethink choices; universities brace for impact
content: Proposed changes to US student visa rules could limit international student stays to four years, replacing the flexible “duration of status” model. This move is expected to impact Indian students more than their Chinese counterparts, as many Indians depend on post-study work routes such as OPT and H-1B visas. Chinese students often pursue funded PhDs or return home, facing less disruption. The shift may prompt Indian students to consider alternative destinations like the UK, Germany, and Australia.

title: US embassy to visa applicants in India: This passport service has been discontinued
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the US will discontinue third-party passport collection services for visa applicants. Individuals can collect their passports in person or opt for home delivery at a fee of Rs 1,200. For applicants under 18, a parent or guardian must collect the passport with an original consent letter from both parents and required identification.

title: Shubman Gill, Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah reach BCCI's CoE for fitness tests
content: Shubman Gill and other senior Indian cricketers are at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence. They are undergoing fitness analysis. Rohit Sharma is preparing for the Australia tour. Speculation suggests Rohit and Virat Kohli may play in the India A series against Australia A. This series will provide valuable match practice. Rohit last played competitively in June.

title: 'India, a long live economy': Shivraj slams Trump’s ‘dead economy’ remark
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Chouhan refuted Donald Trump's "dead economy" remark, citing India's 7.8% GDP growth in April-June. BJP leaders criticized Rahul Gandhi for supporting Trump's statement, highlighting the strong economic figures as evidence of India's progress under Prime Minister Modi's leadership towards becoming a developed and self-reliant nation.

title: Rahul offers candies to black-flag protesters in Bihar - watch
content: During his 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, Rahul Gandhi faced black flag protests from BJYM workers over alleged remarks against PM Modi. In a surprising gesture, Gandhi offered candies to the protesters. He also accused the BJP, RSS, and Election Commission of 'vote chori' during the ongoing electoral roll revision, claiming it's an attack on the Constitution.

title: US court declares Trump Tariffs 'illegal'; Donald Trump retaliates
content: A US court has ruled against Donald Trump's tariffs. The court says the tariffs are illegal. The ruling impacts duties on nations like India. India faces high tariffs on exports. India is exploring new markets. Trump plans to appeal to the Supreme Court. The court decision affects Trump's trade policies. The future of global trade is now uncertain.

title: Watch: Chinese chess player spends 4 hours in heavy rain after loss
content: A video shows a Chinese man analysing his chess loss in the rain. Grandmaster Hans Niemann shared a similar experience. Anish Giri joked about his rain-free victory. Niemann criticised the American chess system, praising India's support for players. Divya Deshmukh received a Rs 3 crore prize for her chess achievements. Chess passion continues to inspire globally.

title: 'Horrific murder': Zelenskyy confirms ex-speaker Parubiy shot dead; vows probe
content: A Ukrainian lawmaker and former speaker of parliament, Andriy Parubiy, was fatally shot in Lviv, prompting a swift condemnation from President Volodymyr Zelensky. Zelensky denounced the killing as a "horrific murder" and pledged a thorough investigation into the incident. Authorities have mobilized all available resources to investigate the crime and apprehend the perpetrator, as confirmed by the president.

title: 'After Awadh, now Magadh': Akhilesh jabs BJP at Rahul's Bihar rally; slams RSS
content: Akhilesh Yadav has criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's claim about Indians sharing the same DNA for 40,000 years, turning it into a political jab during a rally in Bihar. Yadav referenced the BJP's losses in Uttar Pradesh and called for a similar defeat in Bihar, while also pledging support to Tejashwi Yadav in the upcoming assembly polls.

title: iPhone 17 series launching on September 9: Expected prices & other details
content: Apple will host its 'Awe Dropping' event on September 9, 2025. The iPhone 17 series is expected to be unveiled. New Apple Watch models and AirPods updates are also anticipated. The event will showcase expanded Apple Intelligence features. Leaks suggest a slim iPhone variant and titanium Pro models. Next-generation chips and improved photography are expected.

title: 'Financial ruin' for US? What happens if Trump tariffs are struck down by court — Explained
content: A US federal court has dealt President Trump a blow, ruling his sweeping tariffs illegal, stating he exceeded his authority by declaring trade deficits as national emergencies. While the tariffs remain during appeal to the Supreme Court, businesses face continued uncertainty. A potential $159 billion refund looms if the ruling stands, weakening Trump's negotiating power.

title: Security lapse! Babar Azam chased, hugged and kissed by fan during match in Pakistan
content: Despite Babar Azam's Asia Cup 2025 exclusion, his popularity remains high. A fan breached security during a veterans' match, hugging and kissing him. Selectors dropped Azam and Rizwan, citing other players' form, appointing Salman Agha captain. The squad includes Mohammad Wasim, Salman Mirza, and Fakhar Zaman.

title: From Puri to Delhi: Jagannath Rath Yatra wheels to adorn Parliament
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has approved a proposal to install three wheels from the Puri Rath Yatra chariots in the Parliament premises. The Shree Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA) presented the proposal during Birla's visit to Puri. Each wheel will represent the chariots of Lord Jagannath, Devi Subhadra, and Lord Balabhadra, symbolizing Odisha's rich cultural and spiritual heritage.

title: Dravid, Pandit and more: Full list of coach, player changes since IPL 2025
content: Following IPL 2025, Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid steps down after a long association, while Kolkata Knight Riders sees the departure of head coach Chandrakant Pandit and bowling coach Bharat Arun. Pandit, despite leading KKR to a title in 2024, exits after a challenging 2025 season, with Abhishek Nayar returning as assistant coach.

title: Panic at petrol pump: Staff shot for refusing fuel to helmetless youths in MP
content: In Bhind district, Madhya Pradesh, a petrol pump worker was shot and injured for refusing to serve fuel to two helmetless youths, adhering to district rules. The enraged youths returned with firearms, and one opened fire, injuring the worker. Police have identified the accused from CCTV footage and eyewitness accounts and are pursuing their arrest.

title: Maratha quota stir: Traffic comes to standstill in Mumbai — Top developments
content: Manoj Jarange's hunger strike in Mumbai intensifies, demanding a 10% Maratha quota under the OBC category without reducing existing OBC reservations. Jarange warns the government against testing the community's patience, accusing them of misinformation. Traffic in South Mumbai is disrupted as protesters gather, coinciding with the Ganesh festival.

title: 'Discriminatory': Putin blasts Western sanctions against Russia
content: Ahead of his China visit, Vladimir Putin criticized Western sanctions, citing their role in Russia's economic recession due to trade restrictions and Ukraine war costs. He lauded growing Russia-China ties, highlighting increased trade and cooperation across various sectors. Both nations reject discriminatory trade measures, focusing on strengthening economic partnerships and transactions in rubles and yuan.

title: ‘Param Sundari’ box office collection day 2 (Live)
content: Param Sundari, starring Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor, released this Friday. The film earned Rs 3.97 crore on Saturday. Its total collection now stands at Rs 11.22 crore. The movie maintains pace with other romantic comedies released in 2025. Param Sundari had an overall occupancy of 13.85% on Saturday.

title: Princess Diana's time capsule opened: What was found and revealed
content: A time capsule linked to Princess Diana, sealed three decades ago, has been opened, revealing a snapshot of the early 1990s. Contents include a Kylie Minogue CD, a pocket television, and period newspapers and magazines. The capsule offers insights into Diana's life, her connection to pop culture, and the social landscape of the era.

title: Watch: MP school teacher caught drunk, lying half-undressed in viral video; suspended
content: Anjani Kumar Saket, a government school teacher in Mauganj district, Madhya Pradesh, has been suspended after a video went viral showing him drunk and partially undressed on school grounds during working hours.

title: Over 500 drones fired at Ukraine: One killed, dozens injured in Russian attack
content: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Ukraine overnight, resulting in one death and at least 24 injuries. Ukrainian President Zelenskiy reported over 500 drones and 45 missiles targeted 14 regions. In retaliation, Ukraine struck two Russian oil refineries, causing explosions and fires. These events unfold amidst stalled diplomatic efforts, with Zelenskiy urging fresh sanctions on Russia's banking and energy sectors.

title: Watch: Man blames his HIV as ‘act of god’, steals from temple donation boxes
content: A 45-year-old HIV+ man in Chhattisgarh, driven by anger after contracting the virus in prison, confessed to a decade-long looting spree targeting temples in Durg. He stole from donation boxes to express his resentment towards God, believing his infection was an "act of god." Police apprehended him after a recent theft, recovering coins and his two-wheeler.

title: Breaking US laws can cost your student visa: What are the risks? Tips for Indians
content: The US Embassy in India has warned Indian students via X that violating US laws can lead to student visa revocation, deportation, and future ineligibility. Under the Immigration and Nationality Act, grounds include status violations, unauthorised employment, or arrests for offences like driving under the influence. Recent actions revoked over 6,000 visas for breaches such as assault or terrorism support. Indian students must comply to avoid bars on re-entry and protect their educational opportunities abroad.

title: 'Our hearts broke on June 4': RCB issues statement on Bengaluru stampede
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) has launched 'RCB CARES' to support families of the eleven victims of the June 4th tragedy that occurred after their IPL victory parade. Each family will receive Rs 25 lakh as initial support. The franchise aims for long-term community support and fan engagement through this initiative.

title: How a request to wait for prasad turned fatal for sewadar; probe on
content: A 35-year-old sewadar, Yogendra Singh, tragically died at Kalkaji Temple in Delhi after being brutally attacked by a group of 10-15 visitors. The assault occurred following a dispute over the distribution of "Chunni Prasad," when Singh asked them to wait. The visitors, armed with iron rods and sticks, fatally injured Singh, leading to a murder investigation by Kalkaji police.

title: ‘Long live my infamy’: Mahua responds to FIR over Shah remarks
content: Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra faces an FIR after her remarks about Union Home Minister Amit Shah sparked controversy. Following PM Modi's comments on infiltration, Moitra questioned Shah's ability to protect the borders. BJP leaders condemned her statement as distasteful, leading to the FIR.

title: 'Baaghi 4' trailer release: Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Dutt face off in 'bloodbath'
content: Tiger Shroff returns in 'Baaghi 4', a dark and violent chapter in the franchise, co-starring Sanjay Dutt. The R-rated trailer reveals a blood-soaked love story with intense action and brutal fight sequences. Shroff's character embraces a beastly persona, battling masked men and uniformed goons, while Dutt plays a ruthless antagonist, setting the stage for an epic showdown.

title: Kerala: Bank manager from Bihar bans beef in canteen; employees stage protest
content: Employees of Canara Bank in Kochi, under the BEFI banner, protested against the regional manager's alleged ban on serving beef in the bank's canteen. The employees served beef on the premises, asserting that the manager, instructed the canteen staff to exclude the dish due to his personal dietary preferences.

title: Japan done, next stop China: PM Modi wraps up two-day visit; shares key highlights
content: Prime Minister Modi concluded his Japan visit, heading to China for the SCO meet. The visit strengthened India-Japan ties through six agreements, seven MoUs, and eight announcements. Modi emphasized collaboration in manufacturing, technology, green energy, and skill development, highlighting the potential of India-Japan partnership for a clean and green future.

title: ‘Nothing to do with rules’: ABD clarifies ‘CSK’s masterstroke’ remark
content: AB de Villiers clarified his earlier comments on Dewald Brevis, stating he never questioned the legality of his IPL entry. Instead, he emphasized that several franchises, including RCB and Mumbai Indians, missed an opportunity by not investing in the young South African talent. De Villiers urged Brevis to develop his pacing skills while acknowledging his impressive six-hitting ability.

title: Motivational speaker by day, burglar by night: YouTuber held in Rs 20L burglary
content: Manoj Kumar Singh, a motivational speaker known for advocating a crime-free society, was arrested for a burglary in Bharatpur. Despite his public persona, police discovered his extensive criminal history involving theft and burglaries. Authorities were shocked by his dual life and plan to rehabilitate him through vocational training, while neighbors expressed disbelief, believing he had reformed.

title: ‘Not bad for a No 11’: Arshdeep flexes power-hitting ahead of Asia Cup
content: Arshdeep Singh showcased his all-round abilities in the Duleep Trophy quarter-final, smashing two sixes in a cameo and later impressing with the ball. Aquib Nabi's hat-trick helped North Zone dominate East Zone, securing a substantial first-innings lead. Arshdeep's performance, after recovering from a thumb injury, will boost India's confidence ahead of the Asia Cup 2025.

title: Peter Navarro: The Trump aide who blames India for Russia-Ukraine war
content: Like most members of the current Trump administration, the key to understanding Navarro is through a book. Kash Patel has his legal-thriller-style memoir. Navarro’s is more melodrama. I Went to Prison So You Won’t Have To: A Love and Lawfare Story in Trump Land, set for release in September 2025, co-written with his fiancée Bonnie “Pixie” Brenner and featuring a foreword by Steve Bannon, is pitched as part prison diary, part love story, and part political tract.

title: Maharashtra: 3 days after posting ‘RIP’ status for wife, man kills her in Parbhani; held
content: In a shocking incident in Sonapur Tanda village, Vijay Rathod was arrested for the premeditated murder of his wife, Vidya. He attacked her with a sharp weapon following frequent quarrels fueled by suspicions of infidelity. The police investigation revealed that the victim was also harassed by her mother-in-law and brother-in-law for dowry, leading to charges against them as well.

title: On flood survey, mantris chat about luxe cruises; watch video
content: Three Punjab ministers are facing criticism after a video surfaced of them discussing luxury cruise experiences in Sweden and Goa while touring flood-affected areas. The ministers, Harbhajan Singh ETO, Laljit Singh Bhullar, and Barinder Kumar Goyal, were purportedly assessing flood damage when the conversation took place.

title: AI, semiconductors & more: India, Japan outline roadmap; key outcomes of PM Modi’s visit
content: During Prime Minister Modi's visit to Tokyo, India and Japan solidified their partnership by signing 21 agreements, MOUs, and launching initiatives. These collaborations span diverse sectors, including security, space exploration, digital partnership, and clean energy. Modi emphasized the potential of combining Japan's excellence with India's scale, particularly in manufacturing, technology, and green energy.

title: ‘As long as it’s economical’: ONGC to keep buying Russian oil
content: ONGC group refineries will continue purchasing Russian oil as long as it remains financially viable, according to Chairman Arun Kumar Singh. Subsidiaries MRPL and HPCL have been steady buyers, with no US sanctions or Indian restrictions currently in place. The company is also open to acquiring overseas upstream assets and anticipates production from its Mozambique gas project by 2028.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi celebration in Texas parking lot sparks debate online
content: A Ganesh Chaturthi celebration featuring traditional drumming at an India Bazaar parking lot in Lewisville, Texas, sparked a heated online debate. A user criticized the event as a disruptive public nuisance, while others defended it as a yearly cultural celebration. India Bazaar's website indicates the performance was a scheduled event, potentially contradicting claims of unauthorized activity.

title: Bengaluru techie dowry death: Family alleges harassment over skin colour, short stature
content: A 27-year-old Bengaluru woman's death is under investigation, with her husband, Praveen, arrested for allegedly abetting her suicide. Shilpa's family alleges dowry harassment and mistreatment due to her appearance. They claim Praveen, a former software engineer turned panipuri vendor, demanded additional money after an initial dowry of Rs 40 lakh.

title: U.S. tariffs: Carpet industry demands special bailout package
content: According to Akhilesh Singh, Chief Administrative Officer of CEPC's Bhadohi office, India's carpet exports in the last financial year were valued at ₹16,800 crore. Of this, 60% was exported to the U.S. and 40% to European countries

title: Tamil Nadu to conduct telemetry study on Olive Ridley sea turtles to identify movement routes, hotspots
content: The two-year study, which will run from 2025 to 2027, aims to enhance conservation efforts using telemetry technology to monitor turtle behaviour, nesting patterns, and their interaction with fishing activities

title: Noida dowry death: Nikki Bhati’s family meets police Commissioner, seeks speedy justice
content: The family members said the Commissioner Laxmi Singh has assured them that strict action would be taken against all those responsible for Nikki's death

title: Four more held for Virar building collapse that killed 17 in Maharashtra
content: The probe into the tragedy has been handed over to the crime branch of the Mira-Bhayander Vasai-Virar police

title: Rescuers sift through debris in search of missing people after heavy rain in parts of Uttarakhand
content: With the weather improving on Saturday, August 30, in Chamoli and Rudraprayag, search and rescue efforts are likely to gather pace, officials said

title: Yamuna water level nears danger mark in Delhi
content: The warning mark for Delhi is 204.50 metres, while the danger mark is 205.33 metres, and evacuation of people starts at 206 metres

title: ECI will not succeed in its calculations for Bihar, says Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
content: In response to a question on poll predictions, he remarked that any prediction that the DMK alliance would not win the election would be proven wrong

title: Supreme Court to publish list on ‘tainted’ candidates a moral victory say ‘untainted’ teachers
content: Teachers say forcing them to reappear for fresh exams even after ‘tainted’ candidates are identified is a “death sentence” for them

title: Upa Lokayukta continues surprise visit to offices and government establishments in Raichur district for second day
content: He ordered filing a suo moto case against the officials concerned after seeing improper disposal of waste at the Solid Waste Resource Recycling Management Unit located near Yaklaspur village

title: India rains LIVE updates: Ensure swift restoration of Jammu-Srinagar highway: J&K CM tells authorities
content: Heavy rains drenched Delhi, bringing traffic to a standstill on key routes, triggering a wall collapse that injured three children

title: We want only reservation; don’t test patience of Maratha community, says Manoj Jarange as protest enters Day 2
content: Mr. Jarange and his supporters battled mud on the ground due to overnight rains and bemoaned the lack of basic amenities, including a paucity of water in toilets

title: Poozhikkunnu in Thiruvananthapuram has been celebrating Onam with floral carpets for 38 years
content: Under the initiative of the Poozhikkunnu Pourasamithi, giant pookkalams are laid by the residents of the village with flowers bought from Thovala flower market

title: PM Modi arrives in China’s Tianjin ahead of SCO summit | LIVE
content: During PM Modi’s visit to Japan, the two countries firmed up 13 key agreements and declarations and announced the launch of several key initiatives

title: Ready-to-eat Onasadya packs from Kerala find clientele among the Malayali expats
content: Frozen, ready-to-eat Onasadya packs are sold around the world, including the UK, the US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand by various companies in Kerala

title: Deadline to issue 3D notification on land acquisition for Kochi Bypass ends
content: Delay in publishing the notification may lead to an increase in the cost of land acquisition and that of raw materials for the NH project that is estimated to cost ₹6,000 crore

title: PM Modi calls for deeper India-Japan state-prefecture cooperation in meet with 16 governors
content: Discussions focused on ways to further deepen the growing partnerships between Indian states and Japanese prefectures in the fields of technology, innovation, investment, skills, start-ups and SMEs

title: A sunflower field in Thiruvananthapuram is grabbing eyeballs
content: Sunflowers are in full bloom on six acres inside St Xavier’s College, Thumba, at the farm run by agripreneur SV Sujith

title: Mayawati appoints nephew Akash Anand as BSP national convenor
content: According to party sources, Akash's responsibility will be to review the work of all sectors, central and state coordinators and state presidents; he will report directly to Mayawati

title: West Bengal to add 14,000 polling booths next year’s Assembly polls
content: The number of polling booths in the state is about 80,661; if 13,816 booths are added to this, the total number of booths will be 94,497.

title: CBI Court convicts 10 including former Jharkhand Minister Anosh Ekka in land acquisition case
content: The central agency in its official press statement stated that CBI had registered the instant case on 11.08.2010 against Hari Narain Rai and Anosh Ekka and others in compliance of the order passed by the Jharkhand High Court.

title: Noida dowry death: Nikki Bhati’s trial by fire
content: On August 21, Nikki Bhati, 26, died of severe burn injuries in Sirsa, Uttar Pradesh. Married for nine years, Nikki had allegedly complained to her parents often about domestic abuse and dowry demands, but they had urged her to stay on. When Nikki and her sister opened a beauty parlour, the harassment allegedly worsened. Alisha Dutta reports on the horrific crime and the contrasting pieces of evidence that the police have

title: Army, ITBP conduct firepower drills in Arunachal Pradesh
content: The firepower drills were undertaken to ensure seamless coordination in high-altitude operational environments

title: Women biotech scientists await funds for research
content: 75 candidates selected for Science Ministry’s DBT Biocare programme in March unable to commence research

title: BJP supporters vandalise West Bengal Congress headquarters in Kolkata
content: West Bengal Congress president Subhankar Sarkar has demanded arrest of BJP leader Rakesh Singh who led the attack

title: West Bengal CM hails Supreme Court’s intervention on detention of migrant workers
content: PIL on detention of migrant workers was filed before the Supreme Court by the West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board

title: ED conducts searches in FEMA case against Haryana-based real estate firm
content: ED says BPTP Ltd. got FDI of over ₹500 crore from Mauritius-based entities in violation of rules; Agency searches company’s offices as well as residences of its chairman and director

title: A.P. officials on alert as first flood warning level issued for Godavari at Bhadrachalam in Telangana
content: Water level is likely to reach the second warning level of 48 feet at Bhadrachalam on Saturday, says official;  heavy rain is expected in north coastal A.P.

title: Across dynasties and decades, Milad-un-Nabi threads faith, festivity and service
content: Hyderabad’s Milad takes on added significance this time as the city joins the global community in marking the 1,500th birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammed with a grand juloos, prayer meetings and service activities

title: The ocean’s new eyes: Fishermen to join INCOIS in tracking marine trends
content: As part of a citizen-science push, INCOIS will equip fishermen with sensors and satellite tools to feed real-time data from the sea, strengthening advisories on fishing grounds, safety alerts and long-term ocean research

title: India signs pact with Japan for low carbon technologies
content: The Memorandum of Cooperation will facilitate implementation of projects contributing to greenhouse gas reduction or removal and sustainable development in India

title: M.P. BJP worker files complaint after social media users claim he ‘abused’ PM Modi in Bihar
content: The remarks on PM Modi triggered a political storm in poll-bound Bihar as well as in other parts of the country

title: Bihar Cabinet approves Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana
content: As per the scheme, one woman from each family will get ₹10,000 as grant to start a business; this will give women the opportunity to start businesses of their own choice and will create employment opportunities in the State itself

title: Kozhikode Corpn. struggles to identify land for dog park
content: None of the land under the civic body found suitable; expressions of interest invited from private parties; Opposition councillors stage walkout, insisting the park be built on Corporation’s plot

title: Facing outcry, L-G announces probe into Vaishno Devi Shrine landslip that left 34 dead on August 26
content: Several civil society bodies, including Jammu High Court Bar Association, demanded a probe into the incident.

title: NHAI allocates ₹100 crore to repair Kullu-Manali road damaged in flash floods
content: Manali remains cut off after rain, floods and landslides battered NH 21; NHAI is exploring long-term solutions like construction of tunnels and elevated structures

title: Enforcement Directorate seeks fugitive tag for Amira Pure Foods CMD and director
content: The agency tells Delhi court that the two are abroad; proceedings initiated to confiscate assets worth ₹131 crore

title: Lee Corso's impact felt far beyond 'GameDay' audience
content: The larger-than-life face of college football has touched so many, from fans and players to colleagues and friends.

title: Cowboys' Super Bowl, Bulls' title top trends during Corso's first headgear pick
content: Here's a look back at what the world looked like when Corso first donned a mascot's headgear -- Oct. 5, 1996.

title: Drama 'resolved,' Parsons thrilled for fresh start
content: Micah Parsons was introduced by the Packers on Friday and said he was relieved and excited to get back to playing football after a contentious offseason in Dallas.

title: Deion healthy in return, says Buffs 'fine' after loss
content: Deion Sanders said he "felt good" just months after having surgery this spring and, despite criticizing his run defense, said he saw enough good things in Friday's loss to still expect a strong season.

title: Miami LB Hayes charged with vehicular homicide
content: Miami linebacker Adarius Hayes has been charged with three counts of vehicular homicide and one count of reckless driving with serious bodily injury following an investigation into a May crash that killed three people.

title: Suspended Little Leaguer's bat sells for $10K
content: The bat tossed in the air by a New Jersey Little Leaguer to celebrate a home run that earned him a suspension later lifted by a judge sold for nearly $10,000 at auction.

title: 'It's bigger than me': Townsend extends Open run
content: American Taylor Townsend made the most of a spot in prime time at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Friday night, stunning fifth-seeded Mirra Andreeva 7-5, 6-2 to reach the fourth round of the US Open for the first time since 2019.

title: Army falls in Tarleton St.'s 2nd-ever win vs. FBS
content: Tarleton State pulled off a 30-27 stunner in double overtime over Army on Friday night for the Texans' second-ever win over an FBS team.

title: Tong receives ovation, wins debut in Mets' rout
content: Mets' right-hander Jonah Tong allowed one earned run in five innings in his major league debut in a 19-9 victory over the Marlins on Friday night.

title: Red Sox release Buehler, call up prospect Tolle
content: The Red Sox released veteran right-hander Walker Buehler in a series of moves Friday that included calling up top pitching prospect Payton Tolle for his major league debut.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.

content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

content: The Baltimore Ravens running back sits at No. 19 on the rushing list and has a chance to bypass seven Hall of Famers.

content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners, fantasy favorites and QB updates.

content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

content: We've tracked the major contract renewals in 2025 and charted how the summer transfer window played out.

title: Debunking your favorite NFL officiating conspiracy theories
content: Are the refs penalizing some teams more than others? Which coaches win challenges? We crunched the numbers.

content: The Fighting Irish head to Miami as small favorites after making it to the national championship game last season. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Betting NFL milestones: Mike Evans and Derrick Henry chasing down history
content: Potential career milestones are on the horizon for several players. We predict if they get there in 2025.

title: Breaking down Texas-Ohio State, LSU-Clemson and 24 other matchups in an epic Week 1
content: College football is back in a big way, with Arch Manning and Texas taking on the defending champs, a showdown in Death Valley and more.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: As Coco Gauff struggles to change her serve, it's been a rocky US Open already
content: Gauff knew she needed to make a change to her serve -- and she took a gamble, hiring a new coach just days before the US Open.

title: Liz Loza's draft rules (there are none!), five players to pick and two to fade
content: It's finally time to make picks, so consider the trends surrounding these players as you prepare your draft board.

content: The draft is just the beginning of the fun. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a savvy, championship-winning manager.

title: Baylor's anthracite and chrome combo headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: While Baylor revives its gold chrome helmets, Utah State will be donning cow print helmets that have a hilarious origin story.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mainoo tries to find way out of Man United
content: Kobbie Mainoo is trying to find an escape route to leave Manchester United before the transfer window closes. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Body Found In Train Toilet In Bhubaneswar Railway Station
content: Police on Saturday recovered the body of a man from the toilet of the Bhubaneswar-Tirupati Superfast Express at Bhubaneswar railway station, an officer said.

title: PM Modi In China After 7 Years, Set To Meet Xi Jinping Tomorrow
content: Trump's 50% tariffs on India, including a 25% 'penalty' for buying Russian oil, are being seen as having brought New Delhi closer to both Beijing and Moscow.

title: BRS Leader KT Rama Rao Detained For Protest Rally Over Urea Crisis
content: High drama unfolded in the heart of Hyderabad today as leaders of the BRS party, including Working President KT Rama Rao and former Minister T Harish Rao, were detained by police during a protest rally over the state's ongoing urea crisis.

title: PM Modi China Visit LIVE: PM Modi Arrives In China For Regional SCO Summit
content: PM Modi China Visit Day-1 LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in China on Saturday on a keenly watched visit that assumed greater significance in view of sudden downturn in India-US ties triggered by Washington's policies on tariff.

title: Assam Intensifying Crackdown On Infiltrators On 2 Fronts: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam is intensifying its crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immigrants with a two-front approach, said Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, adding that his government would not be restricted to daily pushback operations against infiltrators.

title: "BrahMos Can Be Answer For Foreign Policy": Expert At NDTV Defence Summit
content: The BrahMos supersonic cruise missile can be the "answer for India's foreign policy," said the former Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of BrahMos Aerospace, Atul Dinkar Rane.

title: Mehul Choksi's Bail Plea Rejected By Belgian Court Of Appeal
content: The bail plea of fugitive diamonds trader Mehul Choksi, wanted in India in connection with over Rs 6300-crore fraud in the Punjab National Bank, has again been turned down by a court of appeal in Belgium, just ahead of his extradition hearing

title: Andhra Forms Panel Of Ministers To Decide Fate Of Controversial Rushikonda Resort
content: The Andhra Pradesh government has taken a decisive step toward resolving the long-standing debate over the future of the Rushikonda resort in Visakhapatnam, forming a Group of Ministers (GoM) committee to determine its best use.

title: 'Human GPS', Terrorist Behind 100 Infiltrations, Killed In J&K
content: One of the two terrorists who were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Gurez sector last week has been identified as Bagu Khan, popularly known as 'human GPS'.

title: Himanta Sarma Reveals Why Jamiat Chief Had Complained To Sonia Gandhi
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has hit back at Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind (A) chief Arshad Madani's remark that he had once written to Sonia Gandhi over an election ticket given to him years earlier, when he was in the grand old party.

title: British Museum To Loan Sankardeva's 16th-Century 'Vrindavan Vastra' To India
content: The British Museum in London has agreed to loan the silk textile 'Vrindavani Vastra', created by Vaishnav saint Srimanta Sankardeva in 16th century, to Assam for display in 2027, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Saturday.

title: How Much Does A Brick Cost? For This Panchayat, It's 10 Times The Usual Amount
content: Gram panchayats in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district are once again making headlines for their arithmetic feats when it comes to bills, and this time the humble brick is at the centre of it all.

title: Air Force Came Up With Pak Strike Plan Within 48 Hours Of Pahalgam Attack
content: The Indian Air Force presented its Pakistan air strike plan within 48 hours of the Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir in which 26 people were killed.

title: What Is IEEPA, The Emergency Law That Trump Used To Justify Tariffs
content: The International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), enacted in 1977, gives the US President broad authority to regulate economic transactions once a national emergency is declared.

title: US Court Blocks Trump From Expanding Rapid Deportation Process
content: A US judge on Friday blocked the Trump administration from massively expanding a procedure that allows authorities to swiftly deport migrants without a court hearing, in a blow for the president's mass deportation plans.

title: "Gone Are Days...": Army Commander On How Terror Operations Have Changed
content: A senior Indian Army officer tasked with a major part of Operation Sindoor shares the difficulties that they faced in gathering enough intelligence to launch missiles into the heart of the terrorists.

title: Kash Patel's Girlfriend Called 'Israeli Spy' By Podcaster, She Sues Him
content: FBI Director Kash Patel's longtime partner Alexis Wilkins has sued former federal agent-turned podcaster Kyle Seraphin in a $5 million defamation case.

title: Through 500 Letters, A Son Discovers His Parents' World War 2 Love Story
content: 500 wartime letters reveal the story of Chris and Bessie Barker, whose words carried them from friendship to marriage during World War II.

title: "Very Soon, Bullet Train Is Coming To South India": Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Friday said bullet train connectivity will be established in South India, hinting that it will cater to the needs of Hyderabad, Amaravati, Chennai and Bengaluru.

title: Video: Cars Submerged, Houses Flooded After Heavy Rain In Gujarat's Himmatnagar
content: Videos showed residents struggling to navigate the flooded streets in Himmatnagar. Knee-deep water forced people to wade through the streets.
